channel.title: Mumbai News: Latest Mumbai News Headlines, Coronavirus News, BMC Elections 2022 Updates from Mumbai - Times of India
channel.description: Mumbai News Live: Check the latest Mumbai news, coronavirus headlines & breaking news about Mumbai, BMC Elections 2022, Corona virus, Mumbai crime news, education news, real estate news, politics news, Mumbai rain news and Live Updates on Mumbai local news from Times of India

image.title: Mumbai News: Latest Mumbai News Headlines, Coronavirus News, BMC Elections 2022 Updates from Mumbai - Times of India

item.title: 6-year-old boy falls in open trench; drowns
Mumbai: Man held with charas worth Rs 85 lakh
item.description: The Wadala police on Monday night arrested a 28-year-old man and seized around 17 kg charas valued at Rs 85 lakh. The accused has been booked under the Narcotic and Drugs Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

item.title: Live: Judicial custody of Sanjay Raut extended
Thane: Owner booked for SUV on beach
item.description: Vasai police have booked the owner of an SUV that was pulled out of the waters at Bhuigaon beach after 24 hours on Thursday.

item.title: Three injured in gas cylinder explosion in Dadar
item.description: Three labourers were injured after a gas cylinder exploded on the second floor of Chhabildas School Akshikar Tamhane Community Hall in Dadar West early on Wednesday morning.

item.title: 8 police stations in Mumbai to get new bldgs soon
item.description: New buildings for eight police stations in Mumbai would be constructed soon, sources have said.

item.title: Best daily ridership crosses 1k/bus in Mumbai
item.description: The daily number of passengers per bus has gone over 1,000 in Mumbai, with an average 58 commuters per trip daily. BEST ridership has been growing fast in recent months and is now more than 35 lakh. With the commuter burden on existing 3,600+ buses, there is an urgent need to expand the fleet.

item.title: MBA grads to manage crowds at Mumbai hospital
Over 1,200 nurse regn certs in Maha missing
item.description: In what appears to indicate the existence of a scam involving sale of academic documents, over 1,200 nurse registration certificates have been found missing from the Maharashtra Nursing Council (MNC)'s office, reports Hemali Chhapia.

item.title: Bldr shoots video in cop's chair, lands behind bars
item.description: A Dombivli builder on Tuesday landed behind bars after a video of him seated on a cop's chair at Manpada police station went viral.

item.title: No irregularities in SBUT redevpt: BMC panel
item.description: A committee set up by BMC commissioner and now administrator Iqbal Chahal to probe the alleged irregularities in the nearly Rs 4,000 crore Bhendi Bazaar redevelopment project has given a clean chit to the Saifee Burhani Upliftment Trust (SBUT) that is executing the project, TOI has learnt. The report has been submitted to the administrator's office in a sealed envelope for his approval.

item.title: Raigad: 2 booked for extorting Rs 11L from woman
item.description: Taloja police have registered an FIR against a driver and his aide after a 45-year-old widow filed a complaint claiming that they extorted nearly Rs 11 lakh from her.

item.title: BMC scraps Rs 5,800cr road concretising tender
item.description: Three months after floating five tenders worth Rs 5,800 crore to concretise 400km of roads, the BMC cancelled it on Tuesday.

item.title: Thane developer held over controversial videos
item.description: A Dombivli-based developer having several criminal cases registered against him was arrested by the police after two controversial videos went viral on social media.

item.title: Mumbai cabbie held with Rs 86-lakh charas
item.description: A 30-year-old man was arrested on Tuesday when he was trying to deliver charas worth Rs 86 lakh in Wadala area of Mumbai, police said. The accused works as a private cab driver.

item.title: 'Belapur Kille losing trees to encroachers'
item.description: Nature lovers in Belapur Kille Gaothan, Sector 15A, close to Cidco guest house, are highly disturbed by the latest cutting of 10 big trees along the hill slope.

item.title: Seat belts rule: 204 passengers challaned
item.description: More than 200 passengers of four wheelers who were not wearing seatbelts in the rear seat were issued challans by the traffic police on the first day of their enforcement campaign.

item.title: 2 Malegaon blast witnesses dead, NIA tells court
item.description: The NIA informed the special trial court on Monday, that two witnesses who were to depose in the Malegaon blast case are dead. They died from natural causes and their death certificates were submitted before the court. One of the witnesses had made controversial statements about Pakistani intelligence agency, ISI, and certain payments it made in India.

item.title: Woman dead in Mumbai-Pune e-way crash
item.description: A 37-year-old woman from Pune died and her husband and two minor sons sustained severe injuries in a crash on the Mumbai-Pune expressway.

item.title: 25 tourists drown at Raigad beaches over past 7 years
item.description: Twenty-five tourists drowned on popular picnic spots - Kashid and Chikni beaches in Murud over the past seven years (2015-2022), While 22 tourists drowned off Kashid beach, three drownings took place at Chikni beach, data released by Raigad district police shows.
